title: Lipstick typeface or design
content: I'm looking for a typeface that looks like it was written in lipstick. And if there isn't a font like that, a effect in Photoshop or Illustrator that can create that look. Thanks for any help and suggestions.
author: elisshadesign

comments.content:
[http://www.fontstock.net/3681/Lipstick-Traces.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20141124231715/http:/www.fontstock.net/3681/Lipstick-Traces.html "http://www.fontstock.net/3681/Lipstick-Traces.html")

Why not just write on a whiteboard with your own lipstick?  
Alternatively, you could use almost any thick handwritten font, and apply a filter in Photoshop / live trace in Illustrator

how about writing it with real lipstick on paper and then scanning that...  
--  
<cite>There must be some way out of here...</cite>

I would also suggest the DIY approach of writing it in actual lipstick, and then go about vectorizing or taking a picture of it, whichever the case may be. Might just be more of a person preference, but I would feel a much stronger sense of attachment by doing it that way. Hands on approach to something like that is also something great to achieve.
I would agree with rax and Krebstar. Real lipstick will look better and more believable if you do it your self. Good luck.
